My first job after university was as VP of a student organization.
Every day for 365 days, I was blown away by the dedication and resilience of the youth I worked with. I saw #StudentsStandUp when adults were nowhere to be found. Never count them out or tell them to shut up.

When not one, but two social conservative trolls block you on Twitter because you're so fucking annoying:
"Condragulations, you are the winner of tonight's challenge." https://t.co/969U2tkhL0
The patriarchy is trying to mansplain LGBT people to me and it looks exactly like you think it would https://t.co/StAK7BhjzH
@WEAGLEMAN So by that logic, wouldn't you say that curriculum teaching health and wellness from a strictly heteronormative, cisgender, patriarchal, nuclear perspective is unacceptable?
Doug Ford's Ontario: a place where you can tweet random homophobic conspiracy theories and support them with nothing more than a deflective, "your-facts-are-opinions." https://t.co/Utcp0uOBGk
@11_marlies @WEAGLEMAN You're doing a bang-up job, my friend. I thought referring me to the devil was particularly respectful!

@WEAGLEMAN Which key details, specifically? The part about organized labour? The part about it being a political movement? The part about it exerting undue influence on government?
It's pretty clear that all those devils are in your details.

@WEAGLEMAN LGBT people aren't a political movement. They weren't created by a third party. They're naturally-occurring humans with an identity that is as much a non-negotiable part of them as skin colour or background.
Suggesting otherwise is dehumanizing and--you guessed it--homophobic.
@WEAGLEMAN Ah, but they were, in fact, your words: https://t.co/iKS3IlFNKw
@11_marlies @WEAGLEMAN https://t.co/v2KYgHQBtZ
Shocked that this guy has heard of anal considering it wasn't in the health and wellness curriculum pre-2015. https://t.co/fBnnpipcGD
@11_marlies @WEAGLEMAN Non-point. There's a hyphen in there.
@11_marlies @WEAGLEMAN This is a very well-thought out point.

@11_marlies @WEAGLEMAN you're**
come to think of it, would be nice if you went away again

@WEAGLEMAN People who express far-right, homophobic viewpoints and are somehow shocked when people refer to them as far-right and homophobic would be better off looking at their language rather than complaining about "name calling" and "finger pointing."

@WEAGLEMAN Counterpoint: "parents didn't feel consulted and have concerns about the age-appropriateness of X, Y, or Z."
Homophobia: "gay people are part of a conspiracy to hijack government borne of organized labour, and not actually what they think/say they are."

@WEAGLEMAN You seem to be struggling here, so let me break it down for you:
"Gays aren't people, they're a political movement created by organized labour" isn't an evidence-based counterpoint; it's homophobia. If you don't want to be "labelled," don't say things that earn you that label.

Update: I have been blocked by the homophobic trollbot (success!!), so if you're interested, here is the very well-researched, empirical tweet about social theory I was referencing above. https://t.co/EYl0970pOr
New chicken or the egg question: if I counter-troll a troll account so hard that it blocks me, am I the troll now??

Man, I've heard some pretty whack homophobic conspiracy theories in my time, but LGBT people being a Frankenstein's monster created by unions is by far the stupidest (although it gets bonus points for right-wing consistency, if not originality). https://t.co/19VLfprRkj

Guys, y'all led me to believe that being gay was acceptable but it turns out that it's not??? Eternally grateful to this anonymous account, which is clearly *NOT* a trollbot with literally 0 followers, for helping me see the sinful error of my ways. https://t.co/YHeZt2QC4y

@WEAGLEMAN @RayLee143949 @11_marlies @OntLiberal Again, LGBT people aren’t fiction. They exist. That’s a fact. All people deserve respect. That’s in the curriculum, and that’s also a fact.
I’m not sure what your issue is with humanizing, well, humans, or what your issue is with addressing changing technology and social norms.

@WEAGLEMAN @RayLee143949 @11_marlies @OntLiberal That is not the key message. Not really.
Ford is using this issue as a lightning rod for social conservative sentiment, not as a legitimate point of policy contention. You’ll note that he isn’t entirely sure what the curricular issues are.

@WEAGLEMAN @RayLee143949 @11_marlies @OntLiberal LGBT people aren’t agendas, they’re people. And they deserve to be reflected in their curriculum. People who think that excluding them will make them go away are living in a parallel universe. https://t.co/YrpsoJ2Asb

@WEAGLEMAN @RayLee143949 @11_marlies @OntLiberal If you—presumably cisgender, heterosexual men—think that mocking gender identity while promising to repeal the curriculum *doesn’t* mean LGBT people will be removed (considering we weren’t in it before), you’re either willfully ignorant or living in a patriarchal fantasy land.

@Mickey_Grant95 @ToddSmithPC I think what's desperate is trying to pretend that an MPP didn't literally parrot his leader's line about everyone on the PSSD being a "fatcat" or "insider," then pretending someone else is misrepresenting fact. Cheers.

@RayLee143949 @WEAGLEMAN @OntLiberal Ask for the receipts, and ye shall receive.
Here is the specific video in which Ford refers to gender identity as nonsense and mocks the concept by claiming schools are teaching about six--no wait ten!--no wait six!--genders: https://t.co/NO3jXw40KP

@Mickey_Grant95 @ToddSmithPC Just because he *mentioned* certain individuals doesn't mean MPP Smith didn't generalize. It's the PC talking point, whether you want to own it or not (see your leader's tweet below for reference).
https://t.co/i5N31kuUG0
RT @davidreevely: The thing about "waste" in government is it's easily defined as "services I don't use."

@WEAGLEMAN @OntLiberal Eliminating reference to LGBT youth and the importance of consent PCs proposed a carbon tax in their platform Ford doesn't seem to know what so-called "waste" he intends to cut Tanya doesn't live anywhere near her riding
Yeah, sounds like an enriching perspective for Ontario.

@Mickey_Grant95 @ToddSmithPC *Since you weren't paying attention* the question started with, "The sunshine list is a list of wealthy insiders," not "Let's talk about compensation for Hydro One board members."
When you characterize the PSSD that way, you imply that *everyone* on the list is a politico.

✅ Repealing sex ed ✅ Scrapping cap and trade ✅ Slashing government services ✅ Electing Tanya Granic Allen
These Conservative priorities are all the #MondayMotivation I need to do everything I can to make sure Doug Ford does not become Premier of Ontario. #NotDoug #onpoli

I've said it before, but I'll say it again:
I don't want to hear anybody talking any more shit about "kids these days." Most of us are counting on today's youth to fix yesterday's fuck ups, no thanks to the Marco Rubio's and Ted Cruz's of the world. #MarchForOurLives

Millions of active, passionate, and socially-conscious youth have had enough of being ignored. They know how to engage, they have a worthy cause, they're angry af, and they're all anyone is talking about.
So proud of this generation. Give them hell. #MarchForOurLives
